text: Thomas Samuel Jolliffe (born Petersfield House, Petersfield 22 June 1746 - died Ammerdown House, Kilmersdon 6 June 1824)"Died at Ammersdown Park, Somersetshire, Thomas Jolliffe Esq." Jackson's Oxford Journal (Oxford, England), Saturday, June 12, 1824; Issue 3711. British Library Newspapers, Part I: 1800–1900 was a British politician. Joliffe was the second son of John Joliffe, Member of Parliament for Petersfield from 1741 to 1754, and then again from 1761 to 1768. He was educated at Winchester College. He was High Sheriff of Somerset from 1792 to 1793.Dunning, Robert (1983). A History of Somerset. Chichester: Phillimore & Co. pp. 109–117. ==References== ==External links== * Visit Petersfield Category:1746 births Category:1824 deaths Category:British MPs 1780–1784 Category:British MPs 1784–1790 Category:People educated at Winchester College Category:People from Petersfield
title: Thomas Samuel Jolliffe
